intro: Centaurea bojnordensis, commonly known as the Bojnord thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region, specifically Iran and Azerbaijan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are blue to purple in color. Centaurea bojnordensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and potential ecological significance in its native range.
